org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter
Class CompositeConverter

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter.BaseConverter<Object,Object>
      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.converter.CompositeConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Converter<Object,Object>, FormElementAware<Object,Object>
public class CompositeConverter
extends BaseConverter<Object,Object>

Represents a converter that is composed of multiple converters. This allows reuse of existing converters to simplify creation of different converters.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

CompositeConverter

CompositeConverter

public CompositeConverter(Converter... converters)
Initializes composite converter with given converters. The converters will be processed in the order they are provided here.

Parameters:
converters - Converters to use in the given to reach value conversion to the correct type.

Parameters:

reverseConvertNotNull

protected Object reverseConvertNotNull(Object data)
Description copied from class: BaseConverter
This method should convert the data from one type to another. It may assume that the data is never null. The types of data are reversed in comparison to BaseConverter.convertNotNull(Object).

Specified by:
reverseConvertNotNull in class BaseConverter<Object,Object>
Parameters:
data - Data to convert.
Returns:
Converted data.
